meanings.definition: Crummies (noun): small, dry pieces of bread or cake
meanings.sent1: I accidentally dropped the cookie, and now there are crummies all over the floor.
meanings.sent2: The birds pecked at the crummies left on the park bench.
meanings.sent3: The ants were having a feast on the crummies that fell from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The crummies from the muffin looked like tiny pebbles scattered on the plate.
meanings.sent5: The crummies from the loaf of bread crunched under my feet as I walked.

meanings.sent1: After eating too much candy, I started feeling crummies and had to lie down.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to go to school because she was feeling crummies.
meanings.sent3: The thought of eating spinach made him feel crummies.
meanings.sent4: The crummies feeling lingered even after taking medicine.
meanings.sent5: Being out in the rain without a jacket left me feeling crummies all day.

meanings.definition: Crummies (verb): to break into small pieces or crumbs
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to crummies the delicate cookies when transferring them to the plate.
meanings.sent2: The old book crummiesd in my hands as I turned the pages.
meanings.sent3: The dry leaves crummiesd under my feet as I walked through the forest.
meanings.sent4: The vase accidentally crummiesd into pieces when it fell off the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The sandcastle crummiesd away as the waves washed over it.
